assessment_title: Open Document Format for Office Applications (ODF) v1.2
scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. The objective of the obtained assessment is to determine the suitability of the assessed interoperability specification for the delivery of interoperable European public services.
P1: Open Document Format for Office Applications (ODF) v1.2
criterion_description: The specification has been included in a national catalogue from a Member State whose NIF is fully aligned with at least 4 out of 5 sections of the EIF according to NIFO factsheets.
statement:
ODF is included in 4 national catalogues of recommended specifications. They belong to Denmark, Estonia, the Netherlands and Sweden. The National Interoperability Framework (NIF) of these Member States is fully aligned with at least 4 out of 5 sections of the European Interoperability Framework (EIF) according to the National Interoperability Framework Observatory (NIFO) factsheets. 
 
CAMSS List of standards: 
https://joinup.ec.europa.eu/collection/common-assessment-method-standards-and-specifications-camss/camss-list-standards 
 
National Interoperability Framework Observatory:  
https://joinup.ec.europa.eu/collection/national-interoperability-framework-observatory-nifo/nifo-factsheets

assessment_title: Open Document Format for Office Applications (ODF) v1.2
scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. The objective of the obtained assessment is to determine the suitability of the assessed interoperability specification for the delivery of interoperable European public services.
P1: Open Document Format for Office Applications (ODF) v1.2
criterion_description: The specification facilitates the publication of public data as open data.
statement:
As a document format, ODF helps to make data available on the internet. This fact demonstrates that the standard is supporting the first level of maturity from Tim Berners-Lee's 5-star schema for Open data.  
 
ODF ISO reference:
https://www.iso.org/standard/66363.html

ODF OASIS reference:
https://www.oasis-open.org/committees/tc_home.php?wg_abbrev=office
 
Tim Berners-Lee 5-star schema for Open Data:
https://5stardata.info/es/

assessment_title: Open Document Format for Office Applications (ODF) v1.2
scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. The objective of the obtained assessment is to determine the suitability of the assessed interoperability specification for the delivery of interoperable European public services.
P1: Open Document Format for Office Applications (ODF) v1.2
criterion_description: All stakeholders have the opportunity to contribute to the development of the specification
statement:
ISO has defined a clear procedure to develop its standards. It consists in a 6-steps process where everyone who is interested can participate. However, if you want to participate, you have to contact your national standards body and you have to be approved for joining the Technical committee (TC) who will develop the standard. ISO has defined the roadmap of standards, it is composed of 6 steps as before said. For the approval of a standard the two-thirds majority of P-members of TC is needed. If the result is negative, the document is returned to TC/SC to be further studied.

The ISO standardization process: 
https://www.iso.org/stages-and-resources-for-standards-development.html

assessment_title: Open Document Format for Office Applications (ODF) v1.2
scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. The objective of the obtained assessment is to determine the suitability of the assessed interoperability specification for the delivery of interoperable European public services.
P1: Open Document Format for Office Applications (ODF) v1.2
criterion_description: A public review is part of the decision-making process.
statement:
As defined on the TC standardisation, only TC members are involved in the development of ISO standards. A review is carried out to arrange the consensus firstly within the TC members and subsequently is reviewed by the different ISO member bodies. However, it cannot be considered a public review, because only TC members can participate.

The ISO standardization process: 
https://www.iso.org/stages-and-resources-for-standards-development.html

criterion_description: The specification is available for everyone to study.
statement:
The ISO/IEC 26300-1:2015 which refers to ODF v1.2 is not available for free for everyone to study. Payment is needed to reach access to the standard.

https://www.iso.org/standard/66363.html

assessment_title: Open Document Format for Office Applications (ODF) v1.2
scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. The objective of the obtained assessment is to determine the suitability of the assessed interoperability specification for the delivery of interoperable European public services.
P1: Open Document Format for Office Applications (ODF) v1.2
criterion_description: The specification is sufficiently mature for its use in the development of products and services.
statement:
The first version of ODF was released in 2005, but it was not published as an ISO standard until 2006. It is implemented by LibreOffice, a worldwide Open document format that has the support of The Document Foundation, an open community focused on the improvement of LibreOffice.  

ODF ISO reference:
https://www.iso.org/standard/66363.html

ODF OASIS reference:
https://www.oasis-open.org/committees/tc_home.php?wg_abbrev=office

The Document Foundation  
https://wiki.documentfoundation.org/ODF

assessment_title: Open Document Format for Office Applications (ODF) v1.2
scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. The objective of the obtained assessment is to determine the suitability of the assessed interoperability specification for the delivery of interoperable European public services.
P1: Open Document Format for Office Applications (ODF) v1.2
criterion_description: The specification has sufficient market acceptance for its use in the development of products and services.
statement:
The specification is currently implemented in several initiatives in the public sector. The ODF helps to avoid vendor lock-in, which is part of the recommendations of EIF. Additionally, LibreOffice implements natively different versions of the Open Document Format. This is a key point that reflects the market acceptance of the specification.  

ODF ISO reference:
https://www.iso.org/standard/66363.html

ODF OASIS reference:
https://www.oasis-open.org/committees/tc_home.php?wg_abbrev=office

ODF in a UK government project:
https://www.gov.uk/government/publications/open-standards-for-government/sharing-or-collaborating-with-government-documents

statement: Even though at the moment of elaborating the assessment the specification is used, the specification in itself does not give any innovative solution since it is a document format.

scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. P1: Open Document Format for Office Applications (ODF) v1.2
criterion_description: The specification has a strong support from at least one developer community.
statement:
ODF was initially published by OASIS, an international organisation aimed to develop open standards and specifications. Afterwards, it was standardised by ISO, which is also an international organisation with standardisation purposes. Moreover, the specification has the support of the Document Foundation, which is in charge of evolving the LibreOffice. 

The Document Foundation:
https://wiki.documentfoundation.org/ODF 

ODF ISO reference:
https://www.iso.org/standard/66363.html

ODF OASIS reference:
https://www.oasis-open.org/committees/tc_home.php?wg_abbrev=office

assessment_title: Open Document Format for Office Applications (ODF) v1.2
scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. The objective of the obtained assessment is to determine the suitability of the assessed interoperability specification for the delivery of interoperable European public services.
P1: Open Document Format for Office Applications (ODF) v1.2
criterion_description: The specification fosters the visibility of administrative rules, data, services and decision-making of a public administration.
statement:
As a document exchange format, ODF is a valuable tool for sharing information through the internet between administrations and stakeholders. Also, the XML schema allows the transformation of the content using XSLT by XML based tools. Allowing sharing data and information the standard foster the visibility of administration data and services. Fostering the collaboration between public administrations, the specification eases the decision-making process of institutions.

UK Sharing and collaborating with government documents 
https://www.gov.uk/government/publications/open-standards-for-government/sharing-or-collaborating-with-government-documents

ODF ISO reference:
https://www.iso.org/standard/66363.html

ODF OASIS reference:
https://www.oasis-open.org/committees/tc_home.php?wg_abbrev=office

criterion_description: The specification fosters the comprehensibility of administrative rules, data, services and decision-making of a public administration.
statement:
As a schema for office documents it is an exchange format that allows sharing information over the internet, including content from the public administrations fostering the visibility of administration data and services.

https://www.iso.org/standard/66363.html

criterion_description: The specification fosters data portability between systems and applications supporting the implementation and evolution of European public services when legally possible.
statement:

assessment_title: Open Document Format for Office Applications (ODF) v1.2
scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. The objective of the obtained assessment is to determine the suitability of the assessed interoperability specification for the delivery of interoperable European public services.
P1: Open Document Format for Office Applications (ODF) v1.2
criterion_description: The specification can be mapped to the European Interoperability Reference Architecture (EIRA).
statement:
ODF is already associated to an EIRA ABB in the European Library Of Specifications (ELIS). Specifically, ODF can define the interoperability aspects of the "Representation" ABB from the EIRA Semantic view. 
 
EIRA Library of Interoperability Specifications (ELIS):
https://joinup.ec.europa.eu/solution/elis/release/v100

assessment_title: Open Document Format for Office Applications (ODF) v1.2
scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. The objective of the obtained assessment is to determine the suitability of the assessed interoperability specification for the delivery of interoperable European public services.
P1: Open Document Format for Office Applications (ODF) v1.2
criterion_description: Mechanisms to assess conformity of the implementations of the specification (e.g. conformity tests, certifications) are available for free.
statement:
There are several conformance validators for ODF, for example, The Document Foundation validator.   
 
The Document Foundation ODF Validator: 
https://odfvalidator.org/

assessment_title: Open Document Format for Office Applications (ODF) v1.2
scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. The objective of the obtained assessment is to determine the suitability of the assessed interoperability specification for the delivery of interoperable European public services.
P1: Open Document Format for Office Applications (ODF) v1.2
criterion_description: The specification is recommended by an EU Member State.
statement:
12 Member States are recommending ODF in their ICT National Catalogues. These Member States are Croatia, Denmark, Estonia, France, Greece, Ireland, Malta, Netherlands, Norway, Slovenia, Sweden and UK.
 
CAMSS List of Standards:
https://joinup.ec.europa.eu/collection/common-assessment-method-standards-and-specifications-camss/camss-list-standards

assessment_title: Open Document Format for Office Applications (ODF) v1.2
scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. The objective of the obtained assessment is to determine the suitability of the assessed interoperability specification for the delivery of interoperable European public services.
P1: Open Document Format for Office Applications (ODF) v1.2
criterion_description: The specification has been selected for its use in an EU cross-border project or initiative after agreed identification and assessment.
statement:
Even though no explicit evidence has been found of any implementation of the ODF at the European Level, there are several recommendations from the EC and member states for the usage of the specification when sharing or collaborating between and with administrations.  

No formal project has been found where ODF is used for this purpose. 

EC recommends supporting open document format: 
https://joinup.ec.europa.eu/collection/open-source-observatory-osor/news/ec-recommends-supporting-open 

UK Sharing and collaborating with government documents 
https://www.gov.uk/government/publications/open-standards-for-government/sharing-or-collaborating-with-government-documents

The objective of the obtained assessment is to determine the suitability of the assessed interoperability specification for the delivery of interoperable European public services.
P1: Open Document Format for Office Applications (ODF) v1.2
criterion_description: The specification is included in a catalogue of standards at national level.
statement:
The specification is included in 12 Member States' catalogues of recommended specifications. These Member States including ODF on their catalogues are  Croatia, Denmark, Estonia, France, Greece, Ireland, Malta, Netherlands, Norway, Slovenia, Sweden and UK.

Joinup Assessment Standards: 
https://joinup.ec.europa.eu/collection/common-assessment-method-standards-and-specifications-camss/camss-list-standards

The objective of the obtained assessment is to determine the suitability of the assessed interoperability specification for the delivery of interoperable European public services.
P1: Open Document Format for Office Applications (ODF) v1.2
criterion_description: The specification is included in a catalogue of standards at EU level.
statement:
After checking the different standard catalogues at supra-national level, there is no evidence of the inclusion of ODF within any European catalogue of standards.

ICT technical specifications:
https://ec.europa.eu/growth/industry/policy/ict-standardisation/ict-technical-specifications_en 

CEN search tool catalogue:
https://standards.cen.eu/dyn/www/f?p=CENWEB:105::RESET::::

https://www.cenelec.eu/dyn/www/f?p=104:107:0::::FSP_LANG_ID:25

The objective of the obtained assessment is to determine the suitability of the assessed interoperability specification for the delivery of interoperable European public services.
P1: Open Document Format for Office Applications (ODF) v1.2
criterion_description: The specification is included in an interoperability agreement established between organisations involved in European public service provision.
statement: No evidences have been found of the specification being included in a formal interoperability agreement between organisations involved in the European public services provision.

assessment_title: Open Document Format for Office Applications (ODF) v1.2
scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. The objective of the obtained assessment is to determine the suitability of the assessed interoperability specification for the delivery of interoperable European public services.
P1: Open Document Format for Office Applications (ODF) v1.2
criterion_description: The specification is compliant with a European standardisation regulation (e.g. regulation 1025/2012 on European standardisation).
statement:
After checking the assessments performed by CAMSS and the list of specifications identified by the MSP Multi-stakeholder-platform, no assessment verifying the compliance of the specification with the European standardisation regulation has been found.

ICT technical specifications:
https://ec.europa.eu/growth/industry/policy/ict-standardisation/ict-technical-specifications_en

assessment_title: Open Document Format for Office Applications (ODF) v1.2
scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. The objective of the obtained assessment is to determine the suitability of the assessed interoperability specification for the delivery of interoperable European public services.
P1: Open Document Format for Office Applications (ODF) v1.2
criterion_description: The specification is a commonly accepted business process modelling specification.
statement:
The purpose of ODF is not related to the modelling of business processes. Therefore, this criterion is not applicable to the specification.

ODF ISO reference:
https://www.iso.org/standard/66363.html

ODF OASIS reference:
https://www.oasis-open.org/committees/tc_home.php?wg_abbrev=office

assessment_title: Open Document Format for Office Applications (ODF) v1.2
scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. The objective of the obtained assessment is to determine the suitability of the assessed interoperability specification for the delivery of interoperable European public services.
P1: Open Document Format for Office Applications (ODF) v1.2
criterion_description: The specification defines a cross-sector reusable data model.
statement:
ODF does not define a cross-sector reusable data model, but it defines an open source file format. 

ODF ISO reference:
https://www.iso.org/standard/66363.html

ODF OASIS reference:
https://www.oasis-open.org/committees/tc_home.php?wg_abbrev=office

assessment_title: Open Document Format for Office Applications (ODF) v1.2
scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. The objective of the obtained assessment is to determine the suitability of the assessed interoperability specification for the delivery of interoperable European public services.
P1: Open Document Format for Office Applications (ODF) v1.2
criterion_description: The specification fosters the publication of data as Linked Open Data.
statement:
Although ODF supports the first level of maturity, it does not support the main principles for the publication of data as Linked Open Data.

ODF ISO reference:
https://www.iso.org/standard/66363.html

ODF OASIS reference:
https://www.oasis-open.org/committees/tc_home.php?wg_abbrev=office

5-star linked open data:
https://www.w3.org/DesignIssues/LinkedData.html
